title: Imam Mahjoub Mahjoubi expelled to Tunisia for anti-France comments - Tunisia News
text: Imam Mahjoub Mahjoubi, , was quickly expelled from France to Tunisia after being accused of holding “anti-France” speeches during his sermons on February 2, 9 and 16. The Minister of the Interior, Gérald Darmanin, declared this decision on X. Mahjoubi had described the “tricolour flag” as “satanic” in a sermon broadcast on social networks. An expulsion decree was issued against him after the broadcast of a short extract where he denigrated the French flag. Mahjoub Mahjoubi is accused of having “conveyed a literal, retrograde, intolerant and violent conception of Islam”, according to the ministerial expulsion order. Authorities found other problematic statements from the imam, some praising jihad and demeaning women. This expulsion takes place in the context of the fight against religious extremism in France.
